snippet: Two lawsuits in the Knoedler & Company gallery forgery case, one of the art market’s more stunning scandals, are set to go to trial in January, a federal judge said in a ruling.
abstract: Judge Paul G Gardephe rules there is sufficient circumstantial evidence for two art forgery lawsuits, brought by John D Howard and family of Domenico De Sole against defunct Knoedler & Company gallery and its former president Ann Freedman, to proceed to trial in January 2016; complaints maintain Freedman knew she was selling fake Modernist paintings that she bought from Glafira Rosales, Long Island dealer who plead guilty to fraud in 2013.
lead_paragraph: Two lawsuits in the Knoedler & Company gallery forgery case, one of the art market’s more stunning scandals, are set to go to trial in January, a federal judge said in a ruling.

headline.main: Lawsuits in Knoedler Forgery Case Are Set for Trial
headline.print_headline: Forgery Lawsuits Are Set for Trial
